Class CopyFilesManagerTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void>
      • de.htw.hundertwasser.backend.CopyFilesManagerTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Void>

    public class CopyFilesManagerTask
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void>
    This class will mange how the files are copied.
    Author:
    daniel rhein

      • CopyFilesManagerTask

        public CopyFilesManagerTask(java.io.File[] fileList,
                    java.lang.String targetPath)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor copy files from source to targetPath
        Parameters:
        fileList - List of files
        targetPath - Path where the files should be copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the filelist is empty or null. And it will be thrown if the targetPath is empty or null.

      • moveFile

        private boolean moveFile(java.io.File source,
               java.lang.String target)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is the first attempt to copy files.
        But the methods depends on system-calls which are different on every OS.
        Furthermore you won't copy a file, but you move it from one directory to the target directory.
        This method is obsolete.
        Parameters:
        source -
        target -
        Returns:

      • copyFile

        private void copyFile(java.io.File source,
            java.lang.String target)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                      java.io.IOException
        This method copies source-Files to an given target.
        Parameters:
        source - File that determine absolutley where the file is from.
        target - Target directory, where the file should be copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source is null or the target-directory is empty.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given source can't be found
        java.io.IOException - if it can't be written to the target.
